name: Greek Chicken Kabobs
description: Super juicy, tender kabobs made with the best marinade ever! Olive oil, lemon juice, paprika, oregano, basil, thyme, garlic. SO BOMB.

author.name: Chungah @ Damn Delicious
author.description: Chungah is the recipe developer and photographer of Damn Delicious, a blog that was founded in 2011. She thought she would become an epidemiologist, obtaining a sociology degree at UCLA and a Masters in Public Health at USC. But what began as a grad school hobby blog is now her full-time job. Originally from Queens and living most of her life in Los Angeles, she now resides in Chicago with her crazy corgi duo, Butters and Cartman. She loves donuts and binging on Grey's Anatomy reruns, and hopes to one day start her very own corgi rescue.

recipeIngredient: Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
2 pounds boneless skinless chicken thighs (cut into 1-inch chunks)

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium bowl, combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, lemon juice, lemon zest, paprika, oregano, basil, thyme, garlic, shallot, 1 1/4 teaspoons salt and 1 1/4 teaspoons pepper.
Stir in chicken until well combined; marinate for at least 2 hours to overnight, turning occasionally. Drain the chicken from the marinade.
Thread chicken onto skewers. Brush with remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Add skewers to grill, and cook, turning occasionally, until the chicken is completely cooked through, reaching an internal temperature of 165 degrees F, about 10 minutes.
